Articles.Content:
You must be psychic or somet- OH WAIT!

I bet that took you a second.

Somewhat...made me think.

The,user below,me loves being social with others...even online.

As a retired co-gm, raid leader & strater: hm, average gamer, begginer, totally raid inexperienced players, and funny raid wich used to manage/organize up to 7 raid (and some other events) per day , sometime even two at the same time assisting another raid leader without seeing it's group fight but knowing each raid member and solving other group issue just by listening to the comment while raid leading it's own real time ... ... ...

... partially ...

The user below me hardly has an idea of what i m speaking about* ... partially ... and might be slighty tired of being too social time to time because reasons.

*and this might be because he/she never been to that point yet. just' sayin ,''').

Edited August 21, 2015 by WinkAllKerb''
Hello light green group ; ) it's white here ; ) sorry ; )

True - but only because I didn't read the first part of your post.

The user below me is a european.
Nah, from the alpheonic empire. TUBM is typing this on a mobile device.

nope

the user below me like

(chaussette, chaussette, mais euuuuuuuuuuuuhhhh moi aussi je l'ai dit ... *** le barbare gagne un niveau *** )

I couldn't be bothered to watch it.

TUBM has done the reddit try not to laugh challenge

Nope.

TUBM can actually understand what WinkAllKerb'' says on his posts.

I've given up trying.

TUBM doesn't have a huge backlog of craft they need to post to the forums.

Mine are rarely worth posting, as they are handicapped by parts available in my current career... So mostly true.

TUBM has more than one recently active sandbox save.

Drat...your right. Been testing in prep for a big series involving css.

Tubm likes shutles

It could have been true ; ) so on it not false ; )

The user below me like the "light funny gaming approach" and this dictionnaries definition top of every other kind of silly approach related to overrated merchandising, sponsor and market economy model sub-interest consequences and shenaningan:

Game: an activity you do to get enjoyement, entertainement and relaxation ... & ++ if any of the previous is false then ...

Edited August 22, 2015 by WinkAllKerb''

Sometimes. I play both Serious Business KSP and Wacky Fun KSP, depending on my mood.

The user below me has mood swings.

Nah, I am constant as the northern star.

The user below me knows who General Chang is.

Not much.

TUBM thinks that the sentence "this sentence is false" is false.

Yes, but the question is, does the barber shave himself?

The user below me shave does shave himself.

I shave every couple of days and trim my beard/sideburns every week or so.

TUBM shaves their legs.

Nope.

TUBM shaves his dog's legs.

Who shaves his dog's legs?!?!

The user below me knows what the derivative of Sin(x) is...
Nope not a clue. TUBM has attended college.

I've been to a university. Not sure how college translates to european education.

The user below me likes to watch Star Trek.

Used to alot. Seen every episode from the original thru DS9, Voyager and Enterprise at least twice. Haven't looked at Star Trek for a couple of years now.

TUBM has the DVD pack of Firefly.

Does Bluray count? <3 Firefly, I'll be a Browncoat forever.

The user below me is still mad at Fox for screwing up Firefly.

Does Bluray count? <3 Firefly, I'll be a Browncoat forever.

The user below me is still mad at Fox for screwing up Firefly.

It's on Blu-Ray? Darn, another thing to buy.

And yes, Fox sucks.

TUBM hates Firefly and isn't afraid to admit it and get a good public tongue-lashing.

...what is that?

TUBM is not a native english speaker.
